Sentencas: 8 mol% yttria-stabilized zirconia (8YSZ) ceramic is an oxide ion conductor at atmospheric pressure but shows the onset of p-type semiconduction, in addition to the preexisting oxide ion conduction, on application of a dc bias in the range 4-66 Vcm(-1 )and at temperatures in the range 150 degrees C-750 degrees C.
Titulo: Induced p-type semiconductivity in yttria-stabilized zirconia

Sentencas: The p-type behavior is attributed to the location and hopping of holes on oxygen.
Titulo: Induced p-type semiconductivity in yttria-stabilized zirconia

Sentencas: This contrasts with the commonly observed introduction of n-type conduction under reducing conditions and high fields.
Titulo: Induced p-type semiconductivity in yttria-stabilized zirconia

Sentencas: The hole conductivity increases with both dc bias and pO(2).
Titulo: Induced p-type semiconductivity in yttria-stabilized zirconia

Sentencas: Its occurrence may contribute to the early stages of flash phenomena in 8YSZ ceramics.
Titulo: Induced p-type semiconductivity in yttria-stabilized zirconia
